channel.title: Yes, That's a Thing
channel.itunes:author: WonderAI
channel.description:
Dive into a world of bizarre-but-true phenomena with "Yes, That's a Thing," where reality proves stranger than fiction. In under two minutes per episode, this daily podcast unveils fascinating trends, products, subcultures, and ideas that sound utterly implausible but are absolutely real. From cow cuddling retreats to professional wedding guests, each episode spotlights the peculiar corners of human innovation and culture.
Perfect for curious minds and conversation starters, the show delves into both fleeting trends and established niche communities, delivering concise, factual explorations of these remarkable phenomena. Whether you're an internet culture enthusiast or simply someone who enjoys being the most interesting person at brunch, "Yes, That's a Thing" provides the perfect blend of entertainment and genuine discovery in bite-sized episodes.
Disclaimer: This description is experimental and was generated by AI. It may contain factual errors.
channel.itunes:summary: Daily two minute podcast exploring bizarre but real phenomena from cow cuddling to wedding guests.

itunes:category.text: Comedy > Weird, Society & Culture > Documentaries, Arts

item.title: Cow Cuddling: The $400 Moo-vement in Mental Health
item.itunes:title: Cow Cuddling: The $400 Moo-vement in Mental Health
item.description:
Cow cuddling therapy emerges as a revolutionary wellness trend backed by compelling scientific research. At Mountain Horse Farm in Naples, New York, participants pay $400 to experience therapeutic sessions with specially trained 2,000-pound bovine companions. A groundbreaking study from Utrecht University demonstrates that these sessions can reduce stress hormone levels by an impressive 39 percent, surpassing traditional relaxation techniques. The therapy leverages the cow's natural characteristics – their 102-degree body temperature and slow heartbeat of 40-50 beats per minute – to create a unique form of deep pressure therapy. The practice has gained such legitimacy that the Netherlands has established the world's first professional cow cuddling certification program, while European insurance companies now recognize it as a legitimate treatment for anxiety and depression. Mountain Horse Farm has expanded their offerings to include sunset cuddle sessions, where guests can experience this innovative therapy while watching the sun set.
Learn More: • Mountain Horse Farm Wellness Programs (https://mountainhorsefarm.com/share-a-day-with-horses-cows) • 'The Hidden Magic of Cow Cuddling' (http://www.annarahmanan.com/what-is-cow-cuddling-and-who-practices-it/) • 'Cow Cuddling: A New Approach to Stress Relief' (https://www.today.com/health/cow-cuddling-lets-people-relax-help-friendly-bovines-t163117) • 'Is Cow Hugging the World's New Wellness Trend?' (https://www.bbc.com/travel/article/20201008-is-cow-hugging-the-worlds-new-wellness-trend) • 'Cattle-Aided Mental Health Therapy Research' (https://www.nyu.edu/about/news-publications/news/2024/may/cattle-assisted-mental-health-therapy-shows-promise-in-new-study.html)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.
item.itunes:summary: Cow cuddling therapy reduces stress by 39%, offering unique wellness experience with therapeutic bovine companions.

At Mountain Horse Farm in Naples, New York, participants pay $400 to experience therapeutic sessions with specially trained 2,000-pound bovine companions. A groundbreaking study from Utrecht University demonstrates that these sessions can reduce stress hormone levels by an impressive 39 percent, surpassing traditional relaxation techniques. Mountain Horse Farm has expanded their offerings to include sunset cuddle sessions, where guests can experience this innovative therapy while watching the sun set.
